snippet: Iraqi forces and the American-led coalition are putting pressure on Islamic State fighters to force them into the open so they can be targeted by airstrikes, officials said.
abstract: United States and Iraqi forces see gains after opening multiple fronts against Islamic State; progress, which had been slower than expected, is afforded by recent opportunities for offensives; American training of Iraqi forces is being supplemented by Iranian support for Shiite militias, whose participation is delicate issue.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and ERIC SCHMITT
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Baghdad, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Iraqi forces and the American-led coalition are putting pressure on Islamic State fighters to force them into the open so they can be targeted by airstrikes, officials said.

headline.main: U.S. and Iraqi Forces Take Offensive Against ISIS on Several Fronts
headline.print_headline: U.S. and Iraqi Forces Take Offensive Against Islamic State on Several Fronts

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
